result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J Salmieri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--no possession of illegal drugs

--no possession of drug paraphernalia

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes with Agent approval

--take all prescription medications as prescribed

--random drug screening at the discretion of the Agent

The Court does not order a DNA sample or surcharge due to the age of the case

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY : JEFFERSON COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPT

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry

Case called at 1:31pm [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey J Salmieri in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall submits Amended Information; gives factual basis
--Atty. Meyer accepts the Amended Information and waives reading

As to the State's Motion to Amend the Information
--no objection from Atty. Meyer
--the grants the State's Motion to Amend the Charge; gives basis

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered to the Amended Charge; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Salmieri

The Court finds that the charge reduction and recommendations of the parties are reasonable

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 9 months, with conditions:

--to pay all statutory costs
--no possession of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes with Agent approval
--random drug screening at the discretion of the Agent

The Court does not order a DNA sample or surcharge due to the age of the case

Case called at 10:39am [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey J Salmieri in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Meyer indicates that Mr. Salmieri is still willing to cooperate with co-defendants jury trial; and requests a Plea/Sentencing date after the Co-Defendant's Trial.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling 
The Court indicates if either party would like to adjourn the sentencing the Court will consider that.
The Court reminds Mr. Salmieri that his bond and its conditions remain in effect.

Defendant Jeffrey J Salmieri in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Meyer indicates that the co-defendant's case is scheduled for Trial in August and requests the cases be severed, Further he requests a Status Conference be scheduled for this case after the co-defendant's Jury Trial.

The Court grants this severance.

Case called at 11:04 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeffrey J Salmieri in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with co-Defendant, Robert Smith, except through counsel 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No possesion or consumption of illegal drugs 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-Booking at JCSD 
Court informs parties that co-actor is scheduled for initial appearance later today, will attempt to schedule preliminary hearing at same date/time. If unable to do so, this date may be changed. 
Recess: 11:10 am
